f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, just reviewing it now.  It's not particularly clear about this markup: <p contenteditable="true">...<span contenteditable=false>is this editable?</span>...</p>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:57): it is not

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:57): in particular, this paragraph is a little confusing about that. "If an HTML element  has a contenteditable attribute set to the true state, or if its nearest ancestor HTML element with the contenteditable attribute set has its attribute set to the true state, or if it has no ancestors with the contenteditable attribute set but the Document has designMode enabled, then the UA must treat the element as editable (as described below). "

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:58): since that span falls into the "or if its nearest ancestor HTML element with the contenteditable attribute set has its attribute set to the true state" condition.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:58): is the contenteditable section already updated to match browsers? i think my outstanding comment on that hasn't been addressed yet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:59): in particular, "The false keyword maps to the false state, which is also the invalid value default. " is wrong
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:00): invalid values are equivalent to the attribute being missing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: hm yeah, that needs fixing.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: haven't gotten to that e-mail yet
